s1.title: ISLAND BLISS
s1.description: Discover a unique island where diverse climates coexist 365 days a year.

s4.title: Sunkissed Shores
s4.description: Relax on the sun-kissed shores and crystal clear waters.

s3.title: Wild Adventures
s3.description: Encounter majestic wildlife in their pristine natural habitats.

s7.title: Kingdom of RAVANA
s7.description: A legendary, high-tech golden kingdom; modern Sri Lanka.

jaffna.name: JAFFNA (FORT/CULTURE)
jaffna.description: The cultural hub of the North, famous for its historic fort and unique Tamil heritage.

trincomalee.name: TRINCOMALEE (SOBER ISLAND)
trincomalee.description: Home to Sober Island and the world's deepest natural harbor.

anuradhapura.name: ANURADHAPURA
anuradhapura.description: The first capital of ancient Sri Lanka, home to grand stupas.

polonnaruwa.name: POLONNARUWA
polonnaruwa.description: The second capital, showcasing grand ruins and rock statues.

sigiriya.name: SIGIRIYA
sigiriya.description: An ancient rock fortress rising 200m from the jungle.

dambulla.name: DAMBULLA
dambulla.description: The largest cave temple complex in Sri Lanka.

knuckles.name: KNUCKLES MOUNTAIN RANGE
knuckles.description: A biodiversity hotspot with unique cloud forests.

kandy.name: KANDY
kandy.description: The last royal stronghold and home to the Tooth Relic.

horton.name: HORTON PLAINS CLOUD FOREST
horton.description: High plateau. Source of Mahaweli, Kelani, and Walawe rivers.

peak-wilderness.name: PEAK WILDERNESS SANCTUARY
peak-wilderness.description: Sacred Sri Pada mountain, the source of Kelani and Kalu rivers.

ratnapura.name: GEM CITY RATNAPURA
ratnapura.description: World-famous for blue sapphires and gem mining.

sinharaja.name: SINHARAJAYA RAIN FOREST
sinharaja.description: A primary tropical rainforest and UNESCO site.

galle.name: GALLE
galle.description: A coastal fortress town with colonial architecture.

kataragama.name: SACRED KATARAGAMA
kataragama.description: A multi-religious sacred city and home to the Ruhunu Maha Kataragama Devalaya.

devundara.name: CITY OF GODS - DEVUNDARA
devundara.description: The southernmost point of Sri Lanka, home to the Vishnu Devalaya.

ruhuna.name: KINGDOM OF RUHUNA
ruhuna.description: Ancient kingdom, now a world-renowned leopard sanctuary.

highland.title: High Altitude Lake
highland.subtitle: The Great Lake in the Central Highlands | Mountainous Geography & Lakes | Four (4) Rivers to Four directions to the Ocean.
highland.overlay_desc: Horton Plains (National Park), a 2,100–2,300m high-altitude plateau (lake in dry mode) in Sri Lanka's central highlands, acts as a crucial watershed, with its misty montane forests and grasslands serving as the source of major rivers, including the Mahaweli, Kelani, and Walawe, as well as tributaries like Belihul Oya and Agra Oya & Uma Oya.

water.subtitle: Experience the mist-clad heights and the thunderous beauty.
water.info_desc_1: Sri Lanka, often called the 'Land of Waterfalls,'' holds the world's highest waterfall density with over 400 to 500 recorded waterfalls. Primarily located in the central highlands, these cascades, ranging from the 263m tall Bambarakanda Falls to the wide Bomburu Ella, are fed by heavy monsoons and lush forests, with the highest concentration in the Ratnapura district.
water.info_desc_2: Sri Lanka, often called a 'land of lakes', features an extensive network of ancient man-made reservoirs ('tanks') and natural lakes crucial for irrigation, biodiversity, and tourism. Key water bodies include the massive Parakrama Samudraya, Kalawewa Lake (largest), and Bolgoda Lake, which support wildlife like crocodiles and diverse bird species.

wildlife.subtitle: Venture into the wild heartlands to witness the gentle giants.
wildlife.info_desc_1: Sri Lanka is considered one of the best places in the world to view leopards (Panthera pardus kotiya), with Yala National Park holding one of the highest leopard densities globally. These apex predators thrive across the island, particularly in the dry zone's scrublands and, uniquely, in the wet zone and highland forest patches.
wildlife.info_desc_2: Sri Lanka is often celebrated as a 'land of elephants' due to its remarkably high density of wild Asian elephants (Elephas maximus maximus). The island is home to an estimated 5,000 to 6,000 wild elephants, predominantly found in the dry zones of the north, east, and southeast

climate.empty_profile: Select destination to view climate profile
climate.footer_text: Sri Lanka is the only country in the world where every climate condition exists throughout the year. One can travel to each climatic zone in a few hours. Cultivation in Sri Lanka is also carried out mainly during two main rainfalls.

wet.name: Wet Zone
wet.desc: South-West. High humidity and heavy monsoon rainfall.

intermediate.name: Intermediate Zone
intermediate.desc: Central hills. Mild and pleasant tropical climate.

dry.name: Dry Zone
dry.desc: North & East. Golden plains and bright sunshine.

arid_north.name: Arid Zone (North)
arid_north.desc: Mannar/Jaffna. Intense heat and minimal rainfall.

agro.modal_desc: Agro-tourism in Sri Lanka offers immersive farm stays and experiences, letting visitors engage with traditional practices like tea plucking, spice harvesting, and organic farming, especially in areas like Nuwara Eliya, Kandy, and Sigiriya, blending agricultural education with cultural insights into the island's rich farming heritage. Key attractions include exploring spice gardens, tea estates, paddy fields, and supporting sustainable local practices, with many resorts offering direct involvement in farm activities like milking cows or harvesting crops.

planting.title: Signature Endemics
planting.desc: Join us in making an exemplary contribution to the world by planting a valuable sapling that we provide FREE OF CHARGE.

invest.title: Free Consultation
invest.subtitle: Start your business in Sri Lanka with trusted partnerships
invest.tags: Buy a land | Own hotel | Build your second home

media.title: Travel Album
media.quote: TRAVEL FAR ENOUGH, YOU MEET YOURSELF.

eco.modal_desc: Eco-tourism in Sri Lanka focuses on sustainable travel, offering intimate experiences with the island's high biodiversity, including wildlife safaris, rainforest treks, and eco-lodges. Key areas include Sinharaja Rainforest, Yala National Park, and the Knuckles Mountain Range, emphasizing conservation, local community benefits, and minimal environmental impact.

about.desc_1: Our journey began with a simple passion: to unveil the untold stories and hidden paradises of Sri Lanka to the world. We don't just organize tours; we curate immersive journeys that connect you with the soul of our island.
about.quote: At the core of our service is 'Atithi Devo Bhava'—the ancient belief that every guest is a reflection of God.
about.desc_2: With over 15 years of deep-rooted expertise, we specialize in luxury, sustainable, and tailor-made travel. Your safety and wonder are our priority.

footer.description: Your premier gateway to the wonders of Sri Lanka. We craft memories that last a lifetime.
